original: Lohmander, Sune Kristofer, läroverksadjunkt, Kariskrona, f. 20/2/C0 i Lund av fil. dr Carl Ludvig L. o. Lydia Andersson. — Studiex. i Lund 19, fil. mag. där 26, efterpr. 27, 28, prov-år 31. Vik. ämneslär. i Saltsjöbaden 28-29, vik. adj. i Jönköp. 29-30, extra-lär. i Boden 30, vik. adj. i Sthlm 32- 37, adj. i eng. o. franska v. Karlskrona h. a. 1. sed. 37. Därjämte timlär. v. Stlilms ensk. gymn. 33-34, Kungsholmens ensk. lärov. 34-36, Stlilms bor-garsk. 36-37, Flottans underoff isk. 37-44, språkkurs f. sjöoff. 38-39, Flottans radiosk. 41-43. Resor t. Tyskl. 22, Engl. 29, 34, 3i8 o. 47, Frankr. 26 o. 38 m. fl.
translated: Lohmander, Sune Kristofer, high school teacher, Karlskrona, b. 20/2/1900 in Lund, son of Dr. Carl Ludvig L. and Lydia Andersson. — Graduated from Lund University in 1919, obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in 1926, followed by further studies in 1927, 1928, and a qualifying exam in 1931. Substitute teacher in Saltsjöbaden from 1928-1929, substitute assistant teacher in Jönköping from 1929-1930, temporary teacher in Boden in 1930, substitute assistant teacher in Stockholm from 1932-1937, assistant teacher in English and French in Karlskrona starting from 1937. Additionally, worked as an hourly teacher at Stockholm private gymnasium from 1933-1934, Kungsholmen private high school from 1934-1936, Stockholm municipal high school from 1936-1937, Navy non-commissioned officers' school from 1937-1944, language course for naval officers from 1938-1939, Naval Radio School from 1941-1943. Travels to Germany in 1922, England in 1929, 1934, and 1947, France in 1926 and 1938, among others.
